Behind him, a MAN and WOMAN fuck, covered with blood. She bites through his neck. His head lolls to the other side. She buries her face in the torn flesh as he thrusts into again and again... Presiding over them, KILPACK. His eyes are bloody holes. hands reach out in offering. In the palms of his hands, h eyes. Kilpack opens his mouth and speaks with an INHUMAN VOICE.
Liberatis tutemet ex infera...
Miller switches off the video. No one says anything.
We're leaving.
You can't, your orders are specific...
"...to rescue the crew and salvage  the ship." The crew is dead, Dr.  Weir. This ship killed them. And now  it's killing us.
You're insane. You've lost your mind.

Maybe you're right. But it's still  my command, and I have leeway to  abort when I feel there is an  unacceptable threat to my crew. And  I think there is. (beat) Starck, download all the files from  the Event Horizon's computers. Coop,  Smith, finish moving the CO2 scrubbers  back onto the Clark.
(stammering) Don't... don't do this...
It's done.
Peters enters, carrying heavy CO2 scrubbers. Smith stops  her.
What's going on, sweethearts?
CO2 scrubbers for the Clark. Miller  pulled the plug on the mission.
Smith smiles.
About goddam time.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Weir follows Miller down the Corridor.
What about my ship?
We will take the Lewis and Clark to  a safe distance and then launch tac  missiles at the Event Horizon until  I am satisfied that she has been  destroyed. (beat) Fuck this ship.
You... You can't do that!
Watch me.
Miller turns to walk away. Weir grabs Miller, wheeling hi around, almost frenzied.
You can't kill her, I won't let you!  I lost her once, I will not lose her  again...!
Miller shoves Weir back into the wall. The two stare at e other. Adversaries... The lights cut to emergency lighting.
(intercom) Miller, come in ...
Miller finds the intercom:
Starck, what the hell is going on?
Starck peers at the Engineering board:
(into intercom) We just lost main power again.
Miller and Weir are barely visible in the darkness.
Goddammit! Starck, get those files  and vacate. I want off this ship.
He releases the intercom. Weir's voice is a WHISPER as he backs into the shadows.
You can't leave. She won't let you.
Just get your gear back onto the  Lewis and Clark, doctor, or you'll  find yourself looking for a ride  home.
Weir is swallowed by the darkness.
I am home.
REGULAR LIGHTING snaps on... Miller looks around. Dr. Weir has vanished.
Weir? WEIR!
He slams the intercom:
All hands. Dr. Weir is missing. I  want him found and restrained.
Starck gathers all the files and disks. Shuts down the  consoles, one by one.
Smith and Peters finish removing CO2 scrubbers from panel in the walls.
Let's go, let's go, this place freaks  me out...
Last one.
Peters follows Smith down the First Containment towards t Main Access Corridor, carrying the last case of scrubbers She begins to lag behind. A GIGGLE echoes down the First Containment.
(whisper) Denny?
She turns back to the Second Containment...
A SMALL FIGURE dashes through the darkness in the Second  Containment. Denny...?
Smith.

Peters turns, but Smith is already out of sight. She  hesitates. Moves back towards Second Containment. Again, Peters hears the GIGGLE of a child. The SCRAPE of  metal on metal. She slowly moves forward...
...into the darkness of the Second Containment. Peters se an open access panel. She looks inside.
A narrow tube, vanishing into darkness. A YOUNG CHILD'S V echoes from far away:
Mommy...
ducks her head and enters the access duct.
Denny...?
Miller sits at Justin's engineering position. Flips a ser of switches...
Cooper works on the patch as the ship's running lights co on in sequence...
The bridge lights flicker, illuminate...
(to his ship) Thank you.
(radio) Captain, we got a problem.
Now what?
She was right behind me, I turn  around, she's gone. She could be  anywhere.
Alright. Prep the Clark for launch.  I'll find her.

Peters moves through the duct. Reaches a junction. Anythi could be with her, there in the dark. A child's WHISPER, too faint for words. Peters turns... Behind her, FOREGROUND, a YOUNG CHILD dashes across the  corridor. Peters turns back. Too late to see. Again, the child's WH draws her onward.
Denny? Denny, come to Mommy...
FAINT LAUGHTER is her only answer. She follows the sound, now climbing into a vertical shaft that takes her higher higher...
Hold on, Denny, Mommy's coming...
Peters pulls herself up from the vertical shaft onto a ca that snakes between huge oily machinery, just in time to  see... A SMALL CHILD running, disappearing into the gloom ahead.
Denny?
She runs forward into a junction. The lights flicker red.
Denny...?
Mommy...
Her son can barely be seen in the flickering darkness ahe
You can walk... Denny, you can walk...  oh, my baby...
Wanna show you, Mommy, wanna show  you something...
He reaches his arms out to her... Peters steps forward, reaching for her son... ...falling into an open access hatch, hidden in the dark.
...a twenty meter drop...
Peters hits hard, lies before the Core, an offering of fl and blood. Her legs twist beneath her, shattered; blood p around her head. Her chest heaves: still alive.
(bloody gasp) Denny...
Denny peers down from the top of the shaft and GIGGLES. C his hands in childlike glee.
Weir wanders into First Containment, brooding.
(to himself) I won't. I won't leave. This is my  ship.
Weir enters the Second Containment. Freezes as he sees... Peters body lying twisted and broken before the Core.
Oh no. Peters...?
He rushes to Peters. Reaches out to touch her but pulls h hand back. Her eyes are black, eight-ball hemorrhage dark the irises. She is dead.
Why did you do that? You didn't have  to do that...
Billy.
Weir looks up from Peters' corpse. CLAIRE stands before the Core. She is naked. Her skin is  pale and beautiful and cold and wet. Her hair hangs in he face, covering her milk-white eyes...
Claire stands naked before the bathroom mirror. Behind he the tub steams...

Weir stares at Claire in shock. She walks to him. Slowly. She stops in front of him. Her arms hang at her sides. He must reach for her. He does, putting his hands on her hips. He slides from hi chair to the floor to his knees. He presses his face to h pale belly and cries. SOBS wrack his body...
...and in the bathroom, she clutches Weir's straight-razo
She reaches down. Slowly, her arms cradle his head. She s down on him. Straddles him.
...Claire slips into the steaming water...
He raises his head to her breasts. His eyes, closed. She  remains unnaturally still, only her hips rocking back and forth. Weir's mouth opens, GASPS as he enters her...
...and the razor bites her skin...
She caresses his face. Lifts his face to hers. Her mouth slack. Her hair hangs in front of her eyes.
...Claire floats dead in the red water, eyes open, hair  billowing around her head like a halo...
Weir gazes up at her, transfixed. He takes her hand and r it to his face. She caresses his cheek. And reaches for h eyes...
A MUFFLED SCREAM rips through the Second Containment Seal It begins as a human sound and ends as something else, an alien CRY of rage.
The CRY echoes down the Main Corridor.
DJ packs up blood samples. He raises his head at the soun of the CRY.
Starck GASPS as the CRY resounds through the bridge.
Miller turns in the direction of the CRY. He begins to mo down the Corridor, towards the source.
Cooper examines the weld on the baffle plate. It's solid.
Solid as a rock. (into his radio) Hey, Smith...
(intercom) Smith, clear that airlock, man, I'm  coming in.
Roger that.
Smith carries another load of supplies. Movement out of t corner of his eye... He turns in time to see Weir disappear around a corner in the Event Horizon.
Dr. Weir! Hey, get your ass back on  board! Dr. Weir!
No response. Smith keys the radio.
Skipper, come in...
Miller jogs down the Main Corridor. An INTERCOM gets his  attention:
(intercom) Skipper...
(into intercom) What is it, Smith?
(intercom) I just saw Weir, I think he was  messing around on the Clark.
Something SPARKS and SIZZLES in the dim light, catching  Miller's eye. He looks up... One of the EXPLOSIVE CHARGES has been removed from the it mounting in the Corridor.
Smith, get out of there...
(intercom) Come again, Skipper?
One of the explosives is missing  from the corridor. I think Weir may  have put it on the Clark.
Smith's eyes open wide.
(intercom) Get off the Clark now and wait for  me at the airlock.
No, no, we just got her back  together...
(intercom) Get out of there now!
But Smith has already left the airlock...
...entering the Quarters, tearing through storage lockers
Where is it, where is it...
Smith? Smith! Fuck!
Miller races down the corridor towards the airlock, towar his ship...
A BEEPING sound catches Smith's attention. He follows the sound to a storage compartment. Rifles through it.
I gotcha... I gotcha...
The BEEPS are coming closer and closer together. Smith grabs a duffel.
I gotcha.
Opens it. He sees the EXPLOSIVE CHARGE from the Event Hor even as the BEEPS become a steady TONE. He closes his eye and SIGHS...
Miller enters the docking bay even as a HUGE BLAST knocks him back.
NOOO!
Safety doors close, sealing off the airlock and preventin loss of pressure.
The SILENT EXPLOSION tears the Lewis and Clark into two  pieces, spiralling away from each other and from the Even Horizon. Metal shards, like confetti, fill the space betw them.
Cooper clings to the forward section, watching the Event  Horizon recede as he tumbles into space. His FRENZIED  BREATHING is the only sound.
Miller gets to his feet. Stares out the window upon the  wreckage of his ship, spiralling away. He hits the interc with his forearm.
DJ. The Clark's gone. Smith and Cooper  are dead.
What happened?
(intercom) Weir. He used one of the explosives  from the Corridor.

The door opens behind DJ. The lights go out. DJ turns... Face to face with Weir... Blood crusts Weir's cheekbones, his mouth. He has no eyes Only clotted, empty sockets. DJ opens his mouth to SCREAM. Weir grabs DJ by the throat cutting him off.
DJ, you read me?
DJ does not answer. The CRASH of glass and steel resonate over the intercom.
Too dark to see... glimpses of violent motion in the stai steel cabinets... the sounds of STRUGGLE continue... ...then something WET... and the struggle stops.
(intercom) DJ? DJ, come in...
Finally, Weir emerges from the gloom. He searches among t surgical instruments until his blood caked hands find a  needle... and thread...
Miller, at the intercom. He tries another channel.
Peters...
Peters body lies before the Core. The intercom CRACKLES.
(intercom) Peters, are you there?
(growing panic) Starck, do you read me? Starck...?
But it is Weir who answers. His voice sounds thick, choke with dirt.
(intercom) I told you... She won't let you  leave...
Son of a bitch!
Miller yanks open a storage locker full of zero-G tool. L a nailgun. Chambers a round.

Cooper watches the Event Horizon fall farther and farther away. He checks his oxygen gauge. One tank full, one tank at ha Cooper twists his backpack around, giving him access to t oxygen tanks. He seals off his primary hose and disconnec the full tank. His gauge immediately goes to "Yellow -  Reserve." Cooper points the full tank away from the Event Horizon a OPENS IT... The blast of pressurized air pushes him towards the ship, leaving the wreckage of the Lewis and Clark behind.
Miller races through the corridors to Medical...
...and finds DJ, suspended above the table, neatly dissec His organs have been laid out carefully before him on the steel table.
Oh my God.
DJ raises his head.
(whisper) Please...
Oh, God, DJ, what do I... how do  I...
Please... kill...
Oh God...
Miller raises the nailgun with trembling hands. FIRES.
Miller approaches the door to the Bridge. It is open...
Miller stands in the doorway. A figure sits at the helm.  Miller aims the nailgun.
Weir.
The figure doesn't move. Miller slowly circles around the helm... It's Starck. Bound with wire in a sadomasochistic pose,  unconscious.
Hold on... Get you outta these...

Miller kneels in front of her, puts down the nailgun, loo the cords. She BREATHES in ragged gasps, opens his eyes.. Then stops. She stares over Miller's shoulder like a deer caught in the headlights. Miller looks behind him... WEIR STANDS THERE, STARING WITH EYES SEWN SHUT. Miller reaches for the gun... Weir hits him, sending Miller across the bridge into a  bulkhead. Weir picks up the nailgun, examines it. Miller slowly gets to his feet.
Your eyes...
I don't need them anymore. Where  we're going, we won't need eyes to  see.
What are you talking about?

Do you know what a singularity is,  Miller? Does your mind truly fathom  what a black hole is? (beat) It is NOTHING. Absolute and eternal  NOTHING. And if God is Everything,  then I have seen the Devil. (a dead man's grin) It's a liberating experience.
With his free hand, Weir reaches for the navigation conso Flips a series of switches with gore caked fingers.
The display lights up.
Gravity drive primed. Do you wish to  engage?
What are you doing?
Weir grins as he flips the final switch.
Gravity drive engaged. Activation in  T-minus ten minutes.
Miller lunges for the nailgun. Weir raises the nailgun to point at Miller's face. Miller slowly backs away.
If you miss me, you'll blow out the  hull. You'll die too.
What makes you think I'll miss?
Miller sees something out of the corner of his eye...
Cooper. Outside, braced in the viewport bracket.

Weir spins and FIRES at Cooper. The nail lodges in the th quartz glass. A web of cracks spreads out from the bullet the glass SHRIEKING under the pressure. Weir takes a step towards the window, raises the gun to f again.
Miller dives for the door. Before Weir can fire,
the window EXPLODES outward.

The ship HOWLS as air rushes out, ripping Weir off his fe Weir catches himself in the broken window, trying to pull himself back in... A monitor tears free, SMASHES into him. HE IS SUCKED OUT. Miller pulls himself through the door as it begins to shu He is safe...
Don't leave me!
Miller turns. Starck clings to a console, barely able to  resist the winds that try to suck her into the void.
(gasping for air) Please... help, help me...

Miller hesitates, looking from Starck back into the safet of the ship. The door continues to shut. In seconds, he w be safe. And she will be dead. Miller YELLS and rips a compressor from its mount, wedges in the door to keep it open. He keeps one hand on the doo reaches the other hand to Starck.
Give me your hand! Your hand!

She does. Frost forms on their bodies as the air cools. T veins begin to bulge, blood pulses from their noses. He Y with exertion... ...drags her to the door... through the door... ...as the compressor tears free, sucked into space... ...and the door SNAPS shut, missing them by a fraction.
Starck and Miller collapse against the door. A moment pas between them. Just happy to be breathing... ...and then the AIRLOCK KLAXON goes off.
The forward airlock.
Starck and Miller race towards the Forward Airlock Bay.
They enter, see a humanoid shape moving in the strobing l of the airlock.
Weir can't be alive.
Whatever was on that bridge wasn't  Weir.
Miller looks around for a weapon. Pulls a zero-G bolt cut from the wall. Wields it like a bat.
Stay behind me.
The inner airlock door releases with a HISS. Swings open. Cooper tumbles through, clawing at his helmet.
Cooper!
Starck rushes to him, takes his helmet off. He SUCKS air in, COUGHS it out.
Let me breathe, let me breathe...
You're okay now, it's over...
(sees something) It's not over. It's just starting.
Starck follows Miller's gaze to a workstations's flashing display: GRAVITY DRIVE ENGAGED. ACTIVATION 00:06:43:01...
Weir activated the drive. He's sending  us to the Other Place.
We've got to shut it down, we've got  to...
How? The Bridge is gone.
There must be a way! What about  Engineering?
Can you shut it down?
I don't know the process, Dr. Weir  was the expert...
I don't want to go where the last  crew went. I'd rather be dead.
BLOW THE FUCKER UP.
Blow it up?
We blow the Corridor. Use the  foredecks as a lifeboat, separate it  from the rest of the ship. We stay  put...
...and the gravity drive goes where  no man has gone before.
You prep the gravity couches. I'm  going to manually arm those  explosives.
Will it work?
It worked for Weir. Prep the tanks.
Cooper nods, heads for the gravity couch bay. Starck foll Miller to the steel pressure door.
I'll do it --
No. I'll be right back.
Miller opens the door.
Close it behind me. Just in case.
Beat. Starck stares at Miller as if memorizing his face.
Don't be long.
Miller smiles wanly. The door slides shut with a dull THU

Miller runs down the corridor. Stops at a bulkhead coupli Kneels down to remove the cover from an explosive charge, switch it to MANUAL detonation. Miller runs to the next coupling. Repeats the process...
Starck and Cooper check the gravity couches. One by one,  they slide open...
I'm gonna activate the emergency  beacon.
Hurry.

Cooper exits down a ladder. Starck turns to the console,  activates three gravity couches. Behind her, two begin to fill with blue gel... ...and one begins to fill with blood... the hint of dark  shapes moving within... Starck doesn't see it, concentrates on the console. THUMP. THUMP. Starck turns. Sees the bloody tank. Sees  something moving inside it. She slowly crosses to the tank. Peers at it...

head_text.subj: THUMP. A FACE PRESSES AGAINST THE GLASS, STARING BACK AT

text: HER. WEIR. Bone and muscle are exposed where the skin has finished forming.
Starck SCREAMS and backs away.
Cooper...!
The glass BURSTS in an EXPLOSION OF BLOOD...

A corridor beneath the Gravity Couch Bay. Cooper searches through circuit panels until he finds the EMERGENCY BEACO breaker. He runs a by-pass, activating it manually. The l begins to STROBE... DRIP. DRIP. A bloodstain spreads over his shoulder. He fo the drip to the ceiling...
Starck?
No response. He slowly moves to peer up the ladder... ...as Starck CRASHES down, bloody but alive.
What...?
Run!
She shoves him away... Weir appears at the top of the ladder, crawling down head like a spider... Starck gets to her feet, staggers away...

Miller kneels, removing the cover from the last explosive Flips a switch. A small cover pops open. Miller reaches in, removes a RAD DETONATOR. He arms the explosives. Watches the red lights on the  explosives wink on in the darkness. He reaches for an intercom.
We're armed. This fucker's ready to  blow...
(intercom) ...repeat, we're armed...
Miller, he's back, he was in the  tank...
Slow down, Starck, I can't understand  you, who was in the tank?
A figure seems to coalesce from the shadows behind Miller
(intercom) You have to get back here now, he's  out there now, if he finds you...
The figure moves forward into the light... Arcane runes e Weir's face; his eyes, now restored, blaze with unholy ze
Who? Who?
(intercom) Weir.
He's dead...
Miller glances over his shoulder. His jaw drops in surpri as he sees...
Weir grinning at him... then SMASHES the intercom with hi fist, cutting off Starck's VOICE.
Miller backs away.
Weir stands between Miller and safety.
You're dead, I saw you die.
Weir is dead.
Then who the fuck are you?
Your fear. Do you remember the  Goliath, Miller?

head_text.subj: FLAMES SPREAD OVER WEIR'S BODY, TRANSFORMING HIM INTO THE

text: Do you remember me?
Corrick...
You left me behind.
That's not true...
I begged you. I begged you to save  me and you did nothing. You stood  there and watched me burn...
SHUT UP! SHUT UP!
The Burning Man YELLS and raises his arm in accusation... ...and FIRE RACES OUT FROM BEHIND HIM, flowing over the w the ceiling, the floor, racing for Miller like a rising  tide...
Miller runs. Dead ahead, the First Containment...
Miller runs fast. The fire is faster, flooding in behind  him. Miller dashes for the Second Seal as IT BEGINS TO CLOSE. fire gains on him, surrounding him. Miller dives through the Second Seal...

...barely makes it... ...SLAMS into the engineering console. Miller looks back the Second Seal. It's still open by a fraction when the f hits it... ...SENDING A LANCE OF FLAME stabbing out towards Miller. rolls aside as the fire hits the console. The console  EXPLODES. The Second Seal shuts tight, cutting the fire off. The pa on the Second Seal begins to bubble and scorch... and the cools as the fire subsides. Miller gets to his feet. Almost allows himself to relax.  Then he sees his shadow before him, dancing in the growin red light. He turns...

The Second Containment is a holocaust. Fire swarms over t walls. Burning jelly drips from Control Spikes. The Core  itself is a blazing orb; the gyroscope that holds it glow red-hot. Miller stares at the blazing Core.
Don't leave me!

Miller turns. The Burning Man stands RIGHT BESIDE HIM. He SMASHES Miller with a backhand that ignites Miller's  clothes and sends him flying. The detonator falls from  Miller's grasp, lost beneath two feet of coolant. Miller  comes up CHOKING and SPLUTTERING. The Burning Man stalks towards Miller. The coolant STEAMS and SIZZLES at his feet. Miller stares at the Burning Man as he approaches. Slowly rises to his feet.
You're not Edmund Corrick.

The Burning Man's flames wane, revealing Weir's misshapen form. Miller throws a wicked right. Weir catches Miller's fist. SQUEEZES until blood wells up between his fingers. Then s Miller against a cooling tank with BONE CRACKING force. M collapses into the slime, barely able to raise his head t breathe. Weir slowly approaches.
What are you?
You know.
You want me to believe you're the  Devil, well, I don't, that's bullshit!
I'm not the Devil.
Then what, what are you? Tell me...
Better if I just show you.
Weir's hands reach down and he grabs Miller by the skull. Miller GASPS as he sees...
Faster than the eye can see. More than mind can accept...
The ORIGINAL CREW writhe naked and bloody in carnivorous  frenzy...
Peters' bloody grinning child, devouring his mother...
MILLER writhes in Weir's grip. His hands flail out to the sides. One hand brushes a long steel cannister sunk in th muck. A CO2 scrubber...
DJ's dissected body, except that here, DJ looks up, and  smiles...
AN ALIEN SUN, red and bloated and dying.
AN ALIEN TERRAIN; a sluggish, oily, black sea. A hand rea from the oil...
CLAIRE floating dead in a bathtub filled with the thick b fluid...
Justin, Starck and Cooper, crucified upside-down upon the Third Seal...
NO!
His hand closes on the scrubber and he swings it across W head. Weir reels back, stunned. Miller gets to his feet.
You can't have them!

He hits Weir again. HARD. Blood gushes from Weir's skull, filling the runes on his face. Weir staggers. Miller attacks. Again and again and again. This time Weir is ready. He catches the scrubber and tear it from Miller's grasp. SMASHES Miller to the floor with single blow. Miller GROANS.
I'm not the Devil. I'm much, much  older. I watched the Beginning and I  will see the End. I am the dark behind  the stars. I am the dark inside you  all.
Miller gets to all fours, trying to get up.
...not the Devil...
Weir kicks Miller savagely. Miller slides through the coo comes to rest beneath a walkway. He attempts to rise,  collapses back into the sludge. Weir slowly stalks towards him.
There is no Devil. There is no God.  There is only... NOTHING.
You're lying...!
I'm not asking you to believe me.  You'll see for yourself... and so  will your crew. You're all coming  with me.
Starck... Cooper...
Weir's grotesque face is inches from his. He reaches down and pulls Miller from the dripping ooze...
They are mine. And so are you...
...as Miller clears the surface, he holds something in hi fist. Miller stares dead-on into Weir's hellish face... ...and raises his right hand. HE'S HOLDING THE DETONATOR.
(a grim smile of  triumph) You can't have them. Go to hell.
NOOO!
A small, silent EXPLOSION blossoms in the aft section of ship...
...followed frames later by a sequence of DETONATIONS tha rip the Main Access Corridor apart and propel the foredec away from the containment section.
The EXPLOSION knocks Starck and Cooper down. They hold on tightly as...

Waves of distortion ripple over the Event Horizon's  containment section... A dark sphere of energy spreads out from the containment the gateway opens... A BLACK HOLE... The black hole begins to shrink, imploding. As it collaps it sucks Neptune's blue clouds with it, creating a TITANI WHIRLPOOL with the black hole at its center... The SHRIEKING winds carry the foredecks back towards the  whirlpool, towards the black hole...
Cooper and Starck slide across the floor as the deck tips a terrific angle...

The foredecks teeter on the edge of oblivion... The black hole collapses utterly, vanishing to a point. A enormous SHOCKWAVE rips out from the point of implosion. The foredecks ride the wave away from the implosion and o of Neptune's atmosphere to safety...
The VIBRATIONS subside. Cooper and Starck stagger to thei feet. Look out the window...
Neptune recedes, the ugly hole of the implosion already b erased by Neptune's violent winds...
Starck's voice is tiny.
Miller...

Black planets silhouetted by a dying red giant. The  Engineering Containment of the Event Horizon drifts in th eddies of gas that swirl and spiral into the bloated star MOVE towards the ship until its shadow consumes all...
Starck awakens but the SCREAMS continue as the Event Hori calls out to her... she SCREAMS... hands on her body... t CRIES stop... Starck looks around uncomprehending at the faces around h
Cooper pushes them aside. She clings to him, CRYING...
It's over, hush now, it's over...
